info.title: PIM-MIB MIB API
info.description:
The MIB module for management of PIM routers.

‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT - MIB DATA ACCESS**:
This YANG model exists for SMIv2-to-YANG translation purposes, but MIB data on IOS-XE devices is primarily accessed via **SNMP protocol**, not RESTCONF.

**RESTCONF Limitation**: Many MIB paths may return 404 errors via RESTCONF `/data` endpoints because the device exposes MIB data through SNMP, not the YANG datastore.

**Recommended Access Methods**:
- Use SNMP (v2c/v3) to query MIB data directly
- Use NETCONF `<get>` operations for devices supporting YANG-modeled MIB access
- Check device capabilities: some newer IOS-XE versions may support limited RESTCONF access to specific MIBs

**YANG Model Purpose**: These YANG models define the structure of SNMP MIBs in YANG format for tooling compatibility, but do not guarantee RESTCONF data availability.


**üìä YANG Tree:** [View PIM-MIB structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/PIM-MIB.html)

get.description: Retrieve pim operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune
          messages are to be sent.

pimJoinPruneInterval.description:
The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune
          messages are to be sent.

get.description: Retrieve pimInterfaceTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces.
        IGMP and PIM are enabled on all interfaces listed in this
        table.

pimInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimInterfaceTable.

pimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceMode.description:
The configured mode of this PIM interface.  A value of
            sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.description:
The Designated Router on this PIM interface.  For point-to-
            point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted
            on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry enables PIM
            on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the
            interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are
            transmitted on this PIM interface.  The default value of
            this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description:
The preference value for the local interface as a candidate
            bootstrap router.  The value of -1 is used to indicate that
            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

            sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.description:

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted
            on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry enables PIM
            on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the
            interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are
            transmitted on this PIM interface.  The default value of
            this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description:
The preference value for the local interface as a candidate
            bootstrap router.  The value of -1 is used to indicate that
            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

get.description: Retrieve pimNeighborTable operational data from MIB

schema.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors.

pimNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimNeighborTable.

pimNeighborAddress.description:
The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry
            contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.description:
The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this
            PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.description:
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
            of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be
            aged out.

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

pimNeighborAddress.description:

pimNeighborUpTime.description:

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

get.description: Retrieve pimIpMRouteTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on
        a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteTable defined in the IP
        Multicast MIB.

pimIpMRouteEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteTable.  There
          is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming
          interface is running PIM.

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description:
The time remaining before the router changes its upstream
            neighbor back to its RPF neighbor.  This timer is called the
            Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification.
            
            
            
            
            
            A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the
            upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description:
The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream
            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on
            the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in
            effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a
            multicast state entry.  See the PIM Sparse Mode
            specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a

get.description: Retrieve pimRPTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM version 1 information
        for the Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups.
        This table is deprecated since its function is replaced by
        the pimRPSetTable for PIM version 2.

pimRPEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable.  There is one
          entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimRPEntry entries from MIB

schema.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable.  There is one
          entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

The IP multicast group address for which this entry

get.description: Retrieve pimRPSetTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM information for
        candidate Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups.
        When the local router is the BSR, this information is
        obtained from received Candidate-RP-Advertisements.  When
        the local router is not the BSR, this information is
        obtained from received RP-Set messages.

pimRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPSetTable.

pimRPSetGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of a Candidate-RP.  If the local router is not
            the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be
            declared down.  If the local router is not the BSR, this
            value is 0.

pimRPSetComponent.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each
            protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have
            a different index value.

get.description: Retrieve pimIpMRouteNextHopTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on
        a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteNextHopTable defined in
        the IP Multicast MIB.

pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.
          There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable
          whose interface is running PIM and whose
          ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry entries from MIB

schema.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.
          There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable
          whose interface is running PIM and whose
          ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry entry by key from MIB

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

get.description: Retrieve pimCandidateRPTable operational data from MIB

schema.description:
The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for
        which the local router is to advertise itself as a
        Candidate-RP when the value of pimComponentCRPHoldTime is
        non-zero.  If this table is empty, then the local router
        
        
        
        
        
        will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP for all groups
        (providing the value of pimComponentCRPHoldTime is non-
        zero).

pimCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimCandidateRPEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimCandidateRPEntry entry by key from MIB

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve pimComponentTable operational data from MIB

schema.description: pimComponentTable

pimComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimComponentTable.

pimComponentIndex.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each protocol
            instance connected to a separate domain should have a
            different index value.  Routers that only support membership
            in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex
            value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.description:
The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local
            PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in
            the local domain will be declared down.  For candidate BSRs,
            this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set
            message.  For other routers, this is the time until it may
            accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in
            the local domain.  The value of 0 is used to indicate that
            the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry creates
            another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a
            protocol instance.

            protocol instance.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimInterfaceEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimInterfaceTable.

pimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceMode.description:
The configured mode of this PIM interface.  A value of
            sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.description:
The Designated Router on this PIM interface.  For point-to-
            point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted
            on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry enables PIM
            on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the
            interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are
            transmitted on this PIM interface.  The default value of
            this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description:
The preference value for the local interface as a candidate
            bootstrap router.  The value of -1 is used to indicate that
            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimNeighborEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimNeighborTable.

pimNeighborAddress.description:
The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry
            contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.description:
The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this
            PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.description:
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
            of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be
            aged out.

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimNeighborEntry entry by key from MIB

pimNeighborAddress.description:
The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry
            contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.description:
The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this
            PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.description:
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
            of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be
            aged out.

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimIpMRouteEntry entries from MIB

schema.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteTable.  There
          is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming
          interface is running PIM.

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description:
The time remaining before the router changes its upstream
            neighbor back to its RPF neighbor.  This timer is called the
            Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification.
            
            
            
            
            
            A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the
            upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description:
The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream
            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on
            the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in
            effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a
            multicast state entry.  See the PIM Sparse Mode
            specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimIpMRouteEntry entry by key from MIB

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description:
The time remaining before the router changes its upstream
            neighbor back to its RPF neighbor.  This timer is called the
            Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification.
            
            
            
            
            
            A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the
            upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description:
The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream
            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on
            the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in
            effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a
            multicast state entry.  See the PIM Sparse Mode
            specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimRPEntry entries from MIB

schema.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable.  There is one
          entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimRPEntry entry by key from MIB

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimRPSetEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPSetTable.

pimRPSetGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of a Candidate-RP.  If the local router is not
            the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be
            declared down.  If the local router is not the BSR, this
            value is 0.

pimRPSetComponent.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each
            protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have
            a different index value.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimRPSetEntry entry by key from MIB

pimRPSetGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of a Candidate-RP.  If the local router is not
            the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be
            declared down.  If the local router is not the BSR, this

pimRPSetComponent.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each

get.description: Retrieve list of pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry entries from MIB

schema.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.
          There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable
          whose interface is running PIM and whose
          ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry entry by key from MIB

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimCandidateRPEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimCandidateRPEntry entry by key from MIB

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

get.description: Retrieve list of pimComponentEntry entries from MIB

schema.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimComponentTable.

pimComponentIndex.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each protocol
            instance connected to a separate domain should have a
            different index value.  Routers that only support membership
            in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex
            value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.description:
The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local
            PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in
            the local domain will be declared down.  For candidate BSRs,
            this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set
            message.  For other routers, this is the time until it may
            accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in
            the local domain.  The value of 0 is used to indicate that
            the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry creates
            another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a
            protocol instance.

get.description: Retrieve specific pimComponentEntry entry by key from MIB

pimComponentIndex.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each protocol
            instance connected to a separate domain should have a
            different index value.  Routers that only support membership
            in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex
            value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.description:
The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local
            PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in
            the local domain will be declared down.  For candidate BSRs,
            this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set
            message.  For other routers, this is the time until it may
            accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in
            the local domain.  The value of 0 is used to indicate that
            the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry creates
            another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a
            protocol instance.

PIM-MIB_PIM-MIB.description:
The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune
          messages are to be sent.

pimInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimInterfaceTable.

pimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceMode.description:
The configured mode of this PIM interface.  A value of
            sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.description:
The Designated Router on this PIM interface.  For point-to-
            point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted
            on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry enables PIM
            on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the
            interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are
            transmitted on this PIM interface.  The default value of
            this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description:
The preference value for the local interface as a candidate
            bootstrap router.  The value of -1 is used to indicate that
            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

pimNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimNeighborTable.

pimNeighborAddress.description:
The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry
            contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.description:
The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this
            PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.description:
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
            of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be
            aged out.

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

pimIpMRouteEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteTable.  There
          is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming
          interface is running PIM.

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description:
The time remaining before the router changes its upstream
            neighbor back to its RPF neighbor.  This timer is called the
            Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification.
            
            
            
            
            
            A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the
            upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description:
The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream
            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on
            the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in
            effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a
            multicast state entry.  See the PIM Sparse Mode
            specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

pimRPEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable.  There is one
          entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPSetTable.

pimRPSetGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of a Candidate-RP.  If the local router is not
            the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be
            declared down.  If the local router is not the BSR, this
            value is 0.

pimRPSetComponent.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each
            protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have
            a different index value.

pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.
          There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable
          whose interface is running PIM and whose
          ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

pimCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimComponentTable.

pimComponentIndex.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each protocol
            instance connected to a separate domain should have a
            different index value.  Routers that only support membership
            in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex
            value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.description:
The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local
            PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in
            the local domain will be declared down.  For candidate BSRs,
            this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set
            message.  For other routers, this is the time until it may
            accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in
            the local domain.  The value of 0 is used to indicate that
            the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry creates
            another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a
            protocol instance.

pim.description:
The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune
          messages are to be sent.

pimJoinPruneInterval.description:
The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune
          messages are to be sent.

pimInterfaceTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces.
        IGMP and PIM are enabled on all interfaces listed in this
        table.

pimInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimInterfaceTable.

pimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceMode.description:
The configured mode of this PIM interface.  A value of
            sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.description:
The Designated Router on this PIM interface.  For point-to-
            point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted
            on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry enables PIM
            on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the
            interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are
            transmitted on this PIM interface.  The default value of
            this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description:
The preference value for the local interface as a candidate
            bootstrap router.  The value of -1 is used to indicate that
            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

pimNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors.

pimNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimNeighborTable.

pimNeighborAddress.description:
The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry
            contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.description:
The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this
            PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.description:
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
            of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be
            aged out.

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

pimIpMRouteTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on
        a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteTable defined in the IP
        Multicast MIB.

pimIpMRouteEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteTable.  There
          is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming
          interface is running PIM.

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description:
The time remaining before the router changes its upstream
            neighbor back to its RPF neighbor.  This timer is called the
            Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification.
            
            
            
            
            
            A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the
            upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description:
The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream
            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on
            the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in
            effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a
            multicast state entry.  See the PIM Sparse Mode
            specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

pimRPTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM version 1 information
        for the Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups.
        This table is deprecated since its function is replaced by
        the pimRPSetTable for PIM version 2.

pimRPEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable.  There is one
          entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimRPSetTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM information for
        candidate Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups.
        When the local router is the BSR, this information is
        obtained from received Candidate-RP-Advertisements.  When
        the local router is not the BSR, this information is
        obtained from received RP-Set messages.

pimRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPSetTable.

pimRPSetGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of a Candidate-RP.  If the local router is not
            the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be
            declared down.  If the local router is not the BSR, this
            value is 0.

pimRPSetComponent.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each
            protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have
            a different index value.

pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on
        a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteNextHopTable defined in
        the IP Multicast MIB.

pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.
          There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable
          whose interface is running PIM and whose
          ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

pimCandidateRPTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for
        which the local router is to advertise itself as a
        Candidate-RP when the value of pimComponentCRPHoldTime is
        non-zero.  If this table is empty, then the local router
        
        
        
        
        
        will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP for all groups
        (providing the value of pimComponentCRPHoldTime is non-
        zero).

pimCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimComponentTable.

pimComponentIndex.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each protocol
            instance connected to a separate domain should have a
            different index value.  Routers that only support membership
            in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex
            value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.description:
The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local
            PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in
            the local domain will be declared down.  For candidate BSRs,
            this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set
            message.  For other routers, this is the time until it may
            accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in
            the local domain.  The value of 0 is used to indicate that
            the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry creates
            another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a
            protocol instance.

PIM-MIB_pimInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimInterfaceTable.

pimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

pimInterfaceMode.description:
The configured mode of this PIM interface.  A value of
            sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimInterfaceDR.description:
The Designated Router on this PIM interface.  For point-to-
            point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

pimInterfaceHelloInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted
            on this interface.

pimInterfaceStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry enables PIM
            on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the
            interface.

pimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description:
The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are
            transmitted on this PIM interface.  The default value of
            this object is the pimJoinPruneInterval.

pimInterfaceCBSRPreference.description:
The preference value for the local interface as a candidate
            bootstrap router.  The value of -1 is used to indicate that
            the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

PIM-MIB_pimNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimNeighborTable.

pimNeighborAddress.description:
The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry
            contains information.

pimNeighborIfIndex.description:
The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this
            PIM neighbor.

pimNeighborUpTime.description:
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
            of the local router.

pimNeighborExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be
            aged out.

pimNeighborMode.description:
The active PIM mode of this neighbor.  This object is
            deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the
            interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by
            the protocol running on the interface.

PIM-MIB_pimIpMRouteEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteTable.  There
          is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming
          interface is running PIM.

pimIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description:
The time remaining before the router changes its upstream
            neighbor back to its RPF neighbor.  This timer is called the
            Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification.
            
            
            
            
            
            A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the
            upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetric.description:
The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream
            interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description:
The preference advertised by the assert winner on the
            upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description:
The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on
            the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in
            effect.

pimIpMRouteFlags.description:
This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a
            multicast state entry.  See the PIM Sparse Mode
            specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

PIM-MIB_pimRPEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPTable.  There is one
          entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

pimRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address for which this entry
            contains information about an RP.

pimRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimRPStateTimer.description:
The minimum time remaining before the next state change.
            When pimRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must
            expire until it can be declared down.  When pimRPState is
            down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in
            order to retry).

pimRPLastChange.description:
The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding
            instance of pimRPState last changed its value.

pimRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

PIM-MIB_pimRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimRPSetTable.

pimRPSetGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this
            entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

pimRPSetHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of a Candidate-RP.  If the local router is not
            the BSR, this value is 0.

pimRPSetExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be
            declared down.  If the local router is not the BSR, this
            value is 0.

pimRPSetComponent.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each
            protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have
            a different index value.

PIM-MIB_pimIpMRouteNextHopEntry.description:
An entry (conceptual row) in the pimIpMRouteNextHopTable.
          There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable
          whose interface is running PIM and whose
          ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description:
This object indicates why the downstream interface was
            pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to
            PIM Assert processing.

PIM-MIB_pimCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimCandidateRPTable.

pimCandidateRPGroupAddress.description:
The IP multicast group address which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPGroupMask.description:
The multicast group address mask which, when combined with
            pimCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which
            the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPAddress.description:
The (unicast) address of the interface which will be
            
            
            
            
            
            advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimCandidateRPRowStatus.description:
The status of this row, by which new entries may be
            created, or old entries deleted from this table.

PIM-MIB_pimComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimComponentTable.

pimComponentIndex.description:
A number uniquely identifying the component.  Each protocol
            instance connected to a separate domain should have a
            different index value.  Routers that only support membership
            in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimComponentIndex
            value of 1.

pimComponentBSRAddress.description:
The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local
            PIM region.

pimComponentBSRExpiryTime.description:
The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in
            the local domain will be declared down.  For candidate BSRs,
            this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set
            message.  For other routers, this is the time until it may
            accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimComponentCRPHoldTime.description:
The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in
            the local domain.  The value of 0 is used to indicate that
            the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimComponentStatus.description:
The status of this entry.  Creating the entry creates
            another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a
            protocol instance.
